p: There are two essential FAs that are polyunsaturated fatty acids: linoleic acid (LA) and linolenic acid (ALA) which belong to the omega-6, and omega-3 families, respectively. LA is a precursor of arachidonic acid (AA), and ALA of EPA and DHA fatty acids. Furthermore, the eicosanoids derived from the omega-6 or omega-3 pathways have pro-inflammatory, or anti-inflammatory properties, respectively. Therefore, these should be balanced to maintain proper health and functioning of the body [ 74, 80, 84].
